section.title: Definition
section.para: The test-install top-level element supports automated installation testing. The test-install element is based on the Deployment Elements Common Model. See for a complete description of syntax, macros, attributes and elements.

System Studio accomplishes installation testing using deployment scripts described in the Common Model. Should any of the scripts fail to complete successfully, System Studio halts processing prior to running the test-update and publish events.

Because its focus is on installation testing, the test-install event attempts to perform a clean client installation each time install-related changes occur in the repository. The list of factors that trigger a clean client installation are described under .

informalexample.para: The following examples configure System Studio to perform a test install to a local virtual machine. See the System Studio User Manual for information on configuring the build machine to support virtual machine installations.

This example makes use of two files:
The main repository definition containing a test-install element.
A template named virt-deploy.xml containing deployment scripts. The virt-deploy.xml file is also used across test-install and test-update top-level element examples.

section.title: Example - Test-Install Element
section.para:
This test-install element accomplishes the following:
Sets a root password for the client machine.
Uses XInclude to include all top-level elements from the virt-deploy.xml template.

section.title: Example - virt-deploy.xml template
section.para: The virt-deploy.xml template, shown below, provides the configuration necessary to deploy and maintain a local virtual machine. Virt-deploy.xml in turn makes use of many additional templates. See the section of this document for information on locating and using templates.
